name: Path T Merkel Cell Vulva
title: Pathologic T
notes:
**Note 1:**  In the case of multiple simultaneous tumors, code the tumor with the greatest extension.

**Note 2:**  Skin ulceration does not alter the T category.

**Note 3:**  In-transit metastasis is coded in regional lymph nodes.

**Note 4:**  The depth of stromal invasion is defined as the measurement of the tumor from the epithelial-stromal junction of the adjacent most superficial dermal papilla to the deepest point of invasion.

**Note 5:**  Assign T4 for tumors involving fascia or musculature of vulva and perineum.

**Note 6:** Tumor size must be known to assign a value of T1, T2 or T3. You may use a physicianâs statement of the T category if this is the only information in the medical record. If the tumor appears to be in the T1, T2 or T3 categories, but no size or category is specified, assign TX.

**Note 7:**  For the following descriptions, assign the appropriate T category based on the tumor size.

    Submucosa invasion
    Confined to vulva, NOS

    Localized, NOS
rows:
Surgical resection of primary tumor done and extension not stated or unknown
Surgical resection of primary tumor done and extension not documented in patient record
Surgical resection of primary tumor done, size is part of the T definition and the size is not available but information states that the tumor is confined to the primary

Intraepidermal, intraepithelial, noninvasive

Stated as Tis
Tumor 2 cm or less in greatest dimension
Tumor more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm in greatest dimension
Tumor more than 5 cm in greatest dimension

Tumor invades deep extradermal structures, 
i.e., cartilage, skeletal muscle, fascia, or bone

Anus
Bladder wall or bladder
Extension to underlying cartilage, bone
Fascia
Fixed to pubic bone
Musculature, skeletal muscle
Perianal skin
Perineal body
Rectal mucosa
Rectal wall or rectum, NOS excluding mucosa
Urethra                                                                                             
Vagina

Further contiguous extension

Stated as T4

No pathologic evaluation of primary tumor
No surgical resection of primary tumor and there isn't a positive biopsy of the highest T
Only positive biopsy of tumor which is not the highest T 
Unknown if any pathologic assessment performed
